title: Innovative Social Studies Instructional Design Utilizing Design-Activism

context.prior_knowledge: Basic theory of secondary social studies curriculum and prior studio-classroom teaching experience
context.additional_context: Design-activism-based studio education model applied to pre-service/in-service teachers, aiming to innovate social studies instruction with emphasis on alternative pedagogies overcoming infrastructure constraints

learning_goals: Learners can design social studies project-based lessons using the design-activism framework
Learners can operate studio classes using smartphone-based collaboration tools even in limited-technology environments
Learners can integrate activism strategies for solving community issues into social studies projects

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Collaboration Tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Drive)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
